results.description:
Draw The Episode!

This meetup will be in conjunction with the Episode Screening, so lets take our favorite moments from the episode and bring them to life!

We'll be bringing tools for everyone to use. these are the things we have:

• Two Laptops and a projector


• Wacom Intuos Pro drawing tablet

• Wacom Cintiq (Brought in by Geonine) 

• Pencils and a few sketchbooks


Please bring your own sketchbook, I don't have enough for everyone but I'm working on getting more for the group.

With these tools we are looking to cater to both the traditional and the digital artists in the best possible ways!

Each of the events are scheduled with community artists to demonstrate on the projector. If you are an artist interested in making a demonstration, contact me to reserve time on the projector.

Please note that we will have three separate sections devoted to people that generally want to practice on their art form. Main stage table for those doing the LiveDraw Presentations. Last section is posted for those how like to throw some conversations in the mix, yet to keep a distance for those who like to keep their concentration on their work.

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
Remember a time when games were simpler? When games didn't require big honking boxes full of all sort of contraptions and doodads? When games were in big, bulky cartridges and didn't break when the slightest strain was put on them? Remember when games were super hard with little checkpoints and constant death? NYC Gamer's Night remembers. That's why we're bringing out everybody's old favorite, the SNES, and giving the old codger some recognition by playing games on it all night!

GAMES

Turtles in Time
Battletoads & Double Dragon
Spider Man & Venom: Separation Anxiety
Donkey Kong Country 2 & 3
Kirby Super Star

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.name: Night at the Museum

results.description:
It's the closing weekend of these 2 amazing exhibits...and it's FREE 1st Saturdays sponsored by TARGET!

SNEAKER CULTURE:

 From their modest origins in the mid-nineteenth century to high-end sneakers created in the past decade, sneakers have become a global obsession. The Rise of Sneaker Culture is the first exhibition to explore the complex social history and cultural significance of the footwear now worn by billions of people throughout the world.


The exhibition, which includes approximately 150 pairs of sneakers, looks at the evolution of the sneaker from its beginnings to its current role as status symbol and urban icon. Included are works from the archives of manufacturers such as Adidas, Converse, Nike, Puma, and Reebok as well as private collectors such as hip-hop legend Darryl “DMC” McDaniels, sneaker guru Bobbito Garcia, and Dee Wells of Obsessive Sneaker Disorder. Also featured are sneakers by Prada and other major fashion design houses and designers, as well as those made in collaboration with artists including Damien Hirst and Shantell Martin. Film footage, interactive media, photographic images, and design drawings contextualize the sneakers and explore the social history, technical innovations, fashion trends, and marketing campaigns that have shaped sneaker culture over the past two centuries.

We'll also be checking out FAILE:

 FAILE, a Brooklyn-based collaboration between artists Patrick McNeil and Patrick Miller, raises questions about our relationship to consumer culture, religious traditions, and the urban environment by blurring the boundaries between fine art, street art, and popular culture.


The works on view include multimedia installations, large-scale paintings, and sculptures that appropriate imagery from a wide variety of sources, including American quilts, folk and Native American art, religious architecture, pulp magazines, comic books, sci-fi movie posters, adult entertainment advertisements, and storefront typography.

The exhibition includes The FAILE & BÄST Deluxx Fluxx Arcade, an interactive environment created in collaboration with Brooklyn artist Bäst that includes video games, pinball machines, and foosball tables that are simultaneously sculptures and functioning games. The installation is a nostalgic nod to video arcades and punk rock and graffiti culture.

Also on view is FAILE’s Temple, a life-size structure reminiscent of a ruined religious temple. Made of iron, ceramic reliefs, and painted ceramics, and incorporating prayer wheels and popular-culture imagery, Temple imagines a reaction against commercial development and consumer greed.

DIRECTIONS: Take the 2 or 3 train to EASTERN PARKWAY/BROOKLYN MUSEUM stop. We'll meet out front of the main entrance of museum, to the right bottom of stairs (west side of entrance).
results.name: BROOKLYN MUSEUM FREE SATURDAYS presents: SNEAKER CULTURE and FAILE

results.description:
The first Saturday of every month we meet at 5 pm, instead of the normal weekly Saturday meeting time of 2 pm.

After our meditation program, which ends by 7 pm, we enjoy a healthy potluck dinner.  Please join us!  It's really a great way for us to get to know each other better. 

Log onto www.perfectpotluck.com to let us know what you'd like to bring. Type in Administrator: Fitzpatrick, password: Ananda. You can see what others are bringing to help you decide! Call Linda Fitzpatrick at[masked] if you have any questions or need help entering your food selection on the perfectpotluck.com site.

The potluck goes on until about 9 pm; although you can leave anytime you like.  It's all very informal and friendly.

We meet at the Wilson House of the First Baptist Church, 456 North Street (corner of Bryant Ave.) in White Plains. Email Merrill Harmin, [masked] if you have questions.

Our typical agenda:

- We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives.
- Then we meditate together chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of a gong.
- And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

The group has been meeting for some time before Meetup began. The Meetup page is not a reflection of the group's attendance as it shows only the Meetup members that are planning to attend a particular meeting. The special potluck meeting we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of about two dozen members.
results.name: American Meditation Society  - Monthly Meditation and Potluck Dinner

results.description:
I've been here before and seriously, no BS, it really is a whole lotta fun, just something totally different to do in NYC.


If you thought Shuffleboard was a game for old retirees, well you're kinda right, but now a cool group of hipster Brooklynites have discovered that it's pretty much a kick-ass game that can be enjoyed by all!

What to expect...


• Food trucks with some Vegan options. Heck yeah!


• Black and white booths or vinyl lawn chairs to sit on while you sip cute alcoholic drinks out of Mason Jars.


• Palm trees and turquoise blue courts mirroring 1950's Miami. I think it's ironically trying to look like a trendy retirement home-- Very Boca Raton.

• A disco ball and GREAT music.


• Over-sized games of Connect-four and Jenga, etc. They also have a mini shuffleboard game, cards against humanity, etc.


• Cute corner where you can put on fun hats, glasses, etc. and take photos with your wonderful vegan friends, i.e. ME

Don't forget your ID! (For those of you who have gone out with me outside of the group, you know I'm mostly warning myself. lol).

results.description:
Get your free ticket here with the code DJSPOOKY: 

ow.ly/Sp5bP

Exactly 100 years after the release of D. W. Griffith's silent epic The Birth of a Nation, performance artist and musician Paul D. Miller, aka DJ Spooky That Subliminal Kid, has remixed and reimagined one of the most infamous films ever made. Experience an exclusive one-hour screening and listening party of Miller’s recently released album Rebirth of a Nation, recorded with Kronos Quartet. DJ Spooky will also reveal insights into his process and interpretation of the film, followed by a cocktail reception. Paul D. Miller has recorded a huge volume of music and collaborated with a wide variety of musicians and composers, among them Iannis Xenakis, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Kronos Quartet, Pierre Boulez, Steve Reich, Yoko Ono, Thurston Moore and many others.

“We need more than ever to see the context that early cinema offers us," Miller says. "As my old friend Saul Williams likes to say: Another World Is Possible. A remix of a film as deeply important and problematic as The Birth of a Nation reminds us that many of these issues still linger with us at every level.” Rebirth of a Nation is out now on Cantaloupe Music. Miller is currently an artist-in-residence at Made in NY Media Center by IFP.

Get your free ticket here with the code DJSPOOKY: 

ow.ly/Sp5bP
results.name: DJ Spooky Remixes "The Birth of a Nation"

Hi Everyone,

We are going to have a joint Meetup along with Susan's Meetup group: 

Bay Ridge Book, Game and Social Club,  on:

Saturday, October 3, 2015  from 5:30 PM to 10:00 PM  in Brooklyn, NY.

We'll meet for a bite/drink beforehand at the Prospect Bar and Grill,

at 5:30 PM, located around the corner from The Gallery Players,

at 545 Fifth Avenue (bet. 14th and 15th Streets), where we will have something to eat.

Take a look at their menu here:

http://www.prospectbarandgrill.com/#!food/c1cbs

We will then continue our Meetup by going to see "GODSPELL" @

The Gallery Players

199 14th Street (btw. 4th & 5th Avenues),

Brooklyn, NY(map[masked]

********THERE WILL BE A $2.00 FEE FOR THIS MEETUP.**********

YOU WILL BE ABLE TO SIGN UP FOR THIS MEETUP BEGINNING

FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 18, 2015 @ 6 PM.********** 

 *****IF YOU SIGN UP AND REALIZE THAT YOU CANNOT MAKE IT,

PLEASE BE CONSIDERATE OF OTHERS AND CHANGE YOUR "YES" TO A "NO,"

AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

IF YOU END UP ON THE WAITING LIST AND REALIZE THAT YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO ATTEND, PLEASE CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO A "NO" AS WELL.

A member of Susan's group, Arthur, will once again, set aside premium seats for our group. Tickets are $18 (+ facility fee, if purchased online) and MUST be purchased in advance to guarantee your seat.

THIS FANTASTICALLY POPULAR SHOW IS SURE TO SELL OUT QUICKLY, ESPECIALLY SINCE IT'S THE LAST WEEKEND OF ITS RUN.  RESERVATIONS ARE STRONGLY SUGGESTED. Tickets can be purchased at the door, if you really want to chance seats will be available the night of...

Purchase your tickets here:  http://galleryplayers.com/

For a preview, click here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXezjFLTl-c

GODSPELL Rocks Brooklyn -- Godspell is a revival of the Broadway musical , composed by Stephen Schwartz , composer of huge successes of 'Wicked' and 'Pippin'.  Several cast albums have been released over the years.  One of its songs, "Day by Day", reached #13 on the Billboard pop singles chart in 1972. The structure of the musical is that of a series of parables, mostly based on the Gospel of Matthew.  The parables are interspersed with a variety of modern music set primarily to lyrics from traditional hymns.  Pop music, Stephen Schwartz and The Gallery Players in our own Park Slope, Brooklyn.

You may join us only for the pre-show greet, or only for the show. 

Whatever you decide, a fun evening should be had by all.

 I  am looking forward to spending time with friends and enjoying

a terrific show together.

All the best,

Michele

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

UPDATE: RSVP here at meet up group has been low for some reason this month, but we have a few who signed up for the whole month, and we are having a great time at QED so please join us!  Drop ins are welcome.  No partner or experience necessary!  Single Step 6 count, Shim Sham and maybe 20s Charleston! 

http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa


We are so excited to announce that we will continue to hold beginner series in ASTORIA!!!  This month, we will focus on 6 count moves with single steps, 20s Charleston, & a famous jazz line dance called Shim Sham!!


Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet!!  We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!!  After one hour of class, you will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves to authentic jazz music from 30s and 40s!!


SCHEDULE:
5:30-6:30 Beginner Lesson
6:30-7:00 Social/Dance Party

DATES: We will meet every Saturday in September 
9/12, 19, 26, 10/3  


Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor.  Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it!!  $52 for 4 classes or $15 for single class.


Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot!  Please register in advance at QED website and get the discount!! 


http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa

Classes are taught by Michael Duke and Akemi Kinukawa, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.swingdanceastoria.com)


Here is a video from one of the workshops we had at QED:

https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=537214196418671&set=vb.395724470567645&type=2&theater

If you are interested in finding out what types of materials we cover in the beginner class, please go to Facebook group Swing Dance Astoria and check out the recap video!!  (and like us : )

https://www.facebook.com/swingdanceastoria

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 37-49 - 2f/4m spots left

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Website: http://www.nycgovparks.org/parks/fmcp

It’s time for another light painting event!!

Weather permitting, we will meet at the area between the Unisphere and the Queens Museum of Art before 6pm. Take the 7 train to the Mets-Willets Point station, cross the boardwalk and head for the Unisphere.  We can take a few shots of the Unisphere during the sunset and then we'll find a spot to practice light painting. Sorry, we will NOT be executing any Steel Wool Photography.

Here are two links to short tutorials on Light Painting and Long Exposures:

Light Painting Tutorial Video - Fun with Photography

Cool Long Exposure Photography Ideas

CHECK LIST OF SUPPLIES FOR LIGHT PAINTING:

* Camera and lens with manual settings -- mostly DSLR cameras will have manual settings. Make sure you know how to access your Aperture, Shutter Speed, ISO, focal points on the camera, and manual focus on your lens. If you don't, please review your camera's manual. You should also have access to a timer on your camera, to give yourself a few extra seconds to run in front of your camera, and be ready to start painting.  If you have a different type of camera (ie point and shoot) with manual settings, you should be able to use it as long as you are able to control the shutter speed.

* Camera battery and memory card -- make sure your battery is fully charged and your memory card is formatted and/or empty.

* Tripod -- all long exposures require the camera to be as still as possible, unless you like blurry, unfocused images.

* Your choice of speed light /shoe flash, bright flashlight, LED Light, or colored glow sticks -- you can get the flash light or LED light at any hardware store. Glow sticks can be found at a party store.

* Remote -- this is OPTIONAL. Remotes are usually for long exposures exceeding 30 seconds. If you plan on trying something big and time consuming, a remote would be a good idea.

*Dark clothing -- unless you want to be seen clearly in the photo, dark clothing will work best for light painting.

Please dress for the weather, wear comfortable shoes. Be aware of your surroundings and don't block pedestrian walkways with your tripods.

WARNING: There are no open bathrooms available in the park.

Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are.


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927)

********************

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

********************

[2nd slam of '15-'16 slam season]

Our October slam will be at Casa del Sol in Nyack. We will have:  


--a short open mic [5 people max] 
--a poetry slam limited to 8 folk; the slam'll be 3 rounds 
--a $5 cover 
--$10 for the winner 
--a wonderful group of humans

Sign-ups and doors open at 6:30 PM; poems start at 7.

Any questions? Ask!


RULES FOR THE OPEN MIC: you get 5 minutes to do whatever.


RULES FOR THE SLAM: you get 3 minutes to do 1 original piece, sans costumes, musical accompaniment, props, animals, etc. Anyone can sign up to perform; first 4 slam spots are first-come, first served; last 4 spots will be determined randomly from anyone else that wants to compete. Judges will be chosen from the audience. Top scoring poets advance to the second round and the third round. Different pieces needed for each round so bring three poems!

Any poem you slam with this month cannot be used the next time you slam with us.

Parking is free from 6 PM to 11 PM in the public lots.

Tickets will NOT be available at the door! Purchase here: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=4YRFQT9HFBXDE

=============================================

Join us at the new showroom of Steinway & Sons for this special performance of Olivier Messiaen's masterpiece....

The year was 1940, and war raged across Europe as the Third Reich swept across the continent, leaving unimaginable horror and suffering in its wake. Men, women and children were displaced and scattered across many countries, separated from their families and facing an uncertain future.

French composer Messiaen was captured and imprisoned in Stalag VIII-A, a German POW camp, with fellow musicians Henri Akoka (clarinetist), Etienne Pasquier (cellist), and Jean le Boulaire (violinist). And in this terrible environment, an historic piece of music was born, "Quartet for the End of Time". On the brutally cold night of January 15, 1941, this deeply moving composition was premiered to an audience of inmates and guards. Drawing from his love of birdsong, Hindu rhythms and mystical Catholicism, Messiaen's quartet elevated the prisoners into a spiritual moment away from their despair.

In commemoration of the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II, Young Steinway Artist Jocelyn Ho will present this astonishing work at Steinway, together with international artists Regi Papa (violin), Brian Sanders (cello) and special guest clarinetist Aaron Kruziki.

(Read artist bios ---> HERE)

The evening’s performance will be interwoven with scriptural texts, interviews and accounts that reveal more about the incredibly harsh circumstances surrounding the creation of the piece. Join us for a night that transcends religion, class, earthly suffering, and of course... Time.


SCHEDULE

The 7 pm listed start time is necessary to allow for check-in. The music will begin at 7:30. Please do not arrive after that, as this would be extremely disruptive to the performers and audience members.


ADMISSION

$16 - Before Oct 1

$25 - On/After Oct 1


HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS

1) Use this link: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=4YRFQT9HFBXDE

2) If you are having trouble with Paypal, here is an alternate link on Brown Paper Tickets:

http://steinwaymeetup.brownpapertickets.com

Please note that the price through this processor may be higher ($20-$25).

3) Brown Paper Tickets also takes orders over the phone. The number is:

1 (800)[masked] (Please request event #2332850.)

4) Due to strict venue rules, no tickets can be sold at the door. If you are not on the prepaid list, you will not be admitted under any circumstances.

5) Purchase deadline (by any method) is 11:30 am on the day of the concert or when the venue capacity is reached.

6) Please note the price increase on October 1. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

7) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

8) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled). However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.


POST-CONCERT MEETING:

If there is interest, we will go someplace nearby for drinks and socializing.


See you there!

Milton

Join us at the new showroom of Steinway & Sons for this special performance of Olivier Messiaen's masterpiece....

The year was 1940, and war raged across Europe as the Third Reich swept across the continent, leaving unimaginable horror and suffering in its wake. Men, women and children were displaced and scattered across many countries, separated from their families and facing an uncertain future.

French composer Messiaen was captured and imprisoned in Stalag VIII-A, a German POW camp, with fellow musicians Henri Akoka (clarinetist), Etienne Pasquier (cellist), and Jean le Boulaire (violinist). And in this terrible environment, an historic piece of music was born, "Quartet for the End of Time". On the brutally cold night of January 15, 1941, this deeply moving composition was premiered to an audience of inmates and guards. Drawing from his love of birdsong, Hindu rhythms and mystical Catholicism, Messiaen's quartet elevated the prisoners into a spiritual moment away from their despair.

In commemoration of the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II, Young Steinway Artist Jocelyn Ho will present this astonishing work at Steinway, together with international artists Regi Papa (violin), Brian Sanders (cello) and special guest clarinetist Aaron Kruziki.

(Read artist bios ---> HERE)

The evening’s performance will be interwoven with scriptural texts, interviews and accounts that reveal more about the incredibly harsh circumstances surrounding the creation of the piece. Join us for a night that transcends religion, class, earthly suffering, and of course... Time.


SCHEDULE

The 7 pm listed start time is necessary to allow for check-in. The music will begin at 7:30. Please do not arrive after that, as this would be extremely disruptive to the performers and audience members.


ADMISSION

$16 - Before Oct 1

$25 - On/After Oct 1


HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS

1) Use this link: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=4YRFQT9HFBXDE

2) If you are having trouble with Paypal, here is an alternate link on Brown Paper Tickets:

http://steinwaymeetup.brownpapertickets.com

Please note that the price through this processor may be higher ($20-$25).

3) Brown Paper Tickets also takes orders over the phone. The number is:

1 (800)[masked] (Please request event #2332850.)

4) Due to strict venue rules, no tickets can be sold at the door. If you are not on the prepaid list, you will not be admitted under any circumstances.

5) Purchase deadline (by any method) is 11:30 am on the day of the concert or when the venue capacity is reached.

6) Please note the price increase on October 1. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

7) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

8) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled). However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.


POST-CONCERT MEETING:

If there is interest, we will go someplace nearby for drinks and socializing.


See you there!

Milton

results.description:
Please do not RSVP for this event unless you are 100% committed to attending. We will rely on everyone to bring their assigned ingredients. If you need to change your RSVP to no for any reason please give us plenty of notice.

How the event will work:


To participate in this event each person will be given a list of 5 ingredients that they need to bring to the cook off which will be sent to you via email. 

We are going to form two teams of three. Each team will divide up a list of  ingredients by lottery (so you are not guaranteed to get exactly what you need). Each team will also be provided with staple foods that might be needed to complete their dish. To make this even more challenging there will be opportunities to win or steal additional ingredients.

Each team will have to create an appetizer, dinner, side dish, dessert, and you need to come up with creative names for them all! Of course each dish must contain at least one fruit. All of these dishes need to be created in a set amount of time (80 minutes). There are no recipes, you decide what to make as a team. At the end we will all be the judge. Teams will be judged on appearance taste, and the best named dish.

Special prizes will be awarded :-) 

So let's get together and have some fun!

We have limited kitchen space so there will only be two teams of three, but if the group is full and you would like to be a non-cook guest to be a judge and enjoy the meal please send me an email and I will add you to the event.

If you wish to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event. 

The Fine Print:

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and we can not play properly if there are missing ingredients. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

The prize for the winning team:

I found some really cool twirling spaghetti forks
results.name: Fruits-A COOK OFF!

results.description:
MULTI-GROUP EVENT

Come join us for a "Latin Night @ 46 Lounge" On Saturday October 3rd.

Doors open at 7pm.

Please Bring Your ID. They Check It, Now Matter Your Age.

Here's What You Get:

* Reserved Section Access By The Dance Floor

* Meet & Greet And Drink & Food Specials

* Salsa Lesson At 8pm

* Reduced Cover Price

* DJs Mixing Mostly Latin Early On, Then Some Top 40 Mixed In Later

We Worked Out A Special Pricing For Members. Good Til 10pm.


Only A $5 Cover. You Must Mention Meetup At The Door. Otherwise You'll Be Charged The Normal Door Price, Which Is Higher.

Free Parking Til 9pm. Then Valet Parking Starts After 9pm @ $5 Per Car.

Will have red balloons & meetup signs for you to find us!

Here Are The Drink Specials Available Til 9pm For Members:


* $3 For All Imported & Domestic Beers

* $5 For Specialty Martini's & Cocktails

* $15 For Bucket Of 6 Beers

* $15 For Sangria Or Drink Pitchers

ARRIVE BEFORE 9pm For Free Parking! $5 Parking Charge After 9pm.


ARRIVE BEFORE 10pm For Only A $5 Cover And Access to Our Section!

At 10pm 46 Lounge Will Charge You $10-$15 To Enter. Arrive Before.

Dress Casual But Neat. No Workboots, Baggy Clothing, or Athletic Wear.

Must Mention Meetup At The Door! Please Arrive By 10pm!


Always A Good Time To Be Had @ 46 Lounge!

results.description:
Savas Boyraz presents Back Drop, a video installation for Open Source Gallery.

In Back Drop, Kurdish artist Savas Boyraz explores the stories of individual Kurdish guerilla fighters using portraiture. Having seen people in his life join the fight, Boyraz views his work as a sort of “image-based activism” that he uses to explore the struggle of the Kurdish community in the Middle East, as well as his own roots. Focusing on individuals, Back Drop puts a face to a complex political struggle, exploring a culture that struggles for its rights. Faced with the realities of war and an uncertain future, what are the responsibilities of individuals to their communities, their heritage, and their beliefs?

Kurdistan--an area that is not a country, but an area spread across Turkey, Iraq, Iran and Syria--is inhabited by the Kurds, a group considered to be the largest ethnic community without its own country. For decades, resistance groups have fought for a homeland for the Kurdish people in a continuously tumultuous region. With no national boundaries, identities are formed through self determination--and political rights in autonomous Kurdish communities are only obtained through the resistance of the people. 

In a triptych created in collaboration with Martin Nordström, Boyraz tells the stories of two Kurdish individuals: one who is preparing to leave to join the guerilla struggle against Daesh (ISIS) and one who has returned from the fight. Each individual is situated in front of a backdrop, a prop once used by guerrilla theatre troupes. Set against varied landscapes, the borders of the backdrop provide an oddly precise framing for the portraits. The three stories in triptych format recall religious artwork and encourage the viewer to reflect upon not only the stories being told, but their role in the personal struggles of others. Boyraz not only captures war from the perspective of those fighting it, but explores internal struggles and his relationship with the subjects. He presents the future, present, and past of the Kurdish guerilla struggle, uniting the stories of individuals with one, common backdrop. 

Savas Boyraz was born in Istanbul, Turkey. He obtained his BFA in photography from the Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University and his MFA from the Art in the Public Realm program in Konstfack, University College of Arts, Crafts and Design. Boyraz has received awards from the Hasselblad Foundation, the Swedish Arts Grants Committee, and the HSBC Photography Award. He has participated in exhibitions in the Duhok International Film Festival (Iraq), Amed Art Gallery (Turkey), Berlin Kurdish Film Festival (German), Teatro di Nascosto (Italy), Aperture Foundation (US), Les Rencontres d’Arles (France), and Michaelis Galleries (South Africa) among others.
results.name: OPENING RECEPTION: Savas Boyraz's "Back Drop"

results.description:
Let's head to white plains on Saturday October 3rd to enjoy some wonderful Thai food at  Full Moon Asian Thai Restaurant on Boston Post Road -- we'll meet at 7pm and be seated at 7:30.   I"ll make a reservation for 10.. at 7pm, and your $3 will secure your spot. 

As its name suggests, two halves create Full Moon Asian Thai Restaurant. On one hand is a vibrant, bustling dining room that would not feel out of place in Manhattan. The sounds of lively chatter pervade the open space, hanging over rows of wooden tables where napkins stand upright on plates like swans engaged in staring contests. This electric atmosphere juxtaposes neatly with the quieter corners of the restaurant, where eyes are drawn to elaborate woodcarvings and ears perk up at the sound of water burbling across bricks and sandstones imported from Thailand.


This fusion between West and East—between fast-paced and meditative—carries over to the Zagat -rated restaurant's menu. Sweat-inducing spices strike a balance with the sweet flavors of papaya in colorful curries. Similarly, crushed peanuts and handpicked bean sprouts lend a pleasant crunch to the rice noodles of a traditional pad thai dish. Purple- and orange-tinged lamps dangle above guests as they sample the spread of Thai cuisine, giving them the appearance of tigers at a black-light rave.

Here's a great review by a prior diner: 

"My wife and I had a Groupon and decided to have dinner here one night. The inside is small with about 15 tables with a nice Thai ambience. When it came time to order the hostess was very informative which helped us in making our dinner decision. In addition the owner came out and explained the specials to us. One of the specials was salmon which he stated was sourced from Prince Edward Island. That made an impression on me and showed that it was important enough for him to mention where your potential meal was from. 
We started off with our drink orders with my wife ordering her favorite red wine and I choosing to try a Thai beer. My Thai beer was very refreshing and paired well with the spicy dish I ordered for my entrée. 

Our appetizer was the Steamed pork dumpling. We were given five generous size dumplings that were in a soy type of sauce with a bok choy vegetable accompaniment. The dumplings were very flavorful with the right texture, not chewy and not mushy. We also had the house salads which came with a choice of two types of dressings. I chose the peanut dressing and my wife chose the sesame ginger dressing. Both salads were a mix of greens with cucumber and tomato added in and had the right amount of dressing drizzled on. 

For my entree I chose the Prix Prou with shrimp which is noted to be spicy on the menu. I like my food spicy so I ordered it to be a three pepper rating out of a four. This dish consisted of mixed vegetables and cashews with shrimp added in. The sauce was a spicy chili type of sauce that also had jalapenos in it. The shrimp were kind of on the small side but were cooked perfectly with the vegetables. This spicy dish also went well with the Thai beer I ordered. My wife chose the Grilled tiger prawns which were butterflied large shrimps that were seasoned and grilled and put on wedges of sliced potatoes. It came with a lime ginger type of sauce which she thought was very tasty. Our server also bought out hot sauces to try with her dish in case she wanted to make it a little spicier. 

We decided to order desert and ordered the fried banana. This turned out to be one of the best deserts I ever had bar none. The banana was coated in a coconut batter and deep fried. It was crispy and not greasy at all. It was accompanied with green tea ice cream and whipped cream. The ice cream had the right consistency not too hard or too soft. Let me warn you that once you have this desert you may become addicted because I have been thinking about it ever since. I also ordered tea and could not decide between the Jasmine or Thai tea. The owner explained what both teas were like and I eventually chose the Thai tea. He also brought me the Jasmine tea to try so I had two teas to finish my meal with. This place turned out to be a gem and we will definitely go back again."

wow what a statement! 

Other diners are more succinct: "My husband always orders the Pad Thai chicken and loves it. I alternate between the Pad See Ewe and one of the currys. The service is lovely and the atmosphere comfortably intimate."

Another wrote: "Love this place. Great food is always fresh and super tasty. This red curry is tinglingly hot.....perfect. Service always excellent too. Try it, you will love it too."

And one more, "I like Thai foods and often choose Thai restaurant when eating out. I'm sure that Full Moon is the best Thai restaurant in Westchester. Waitresses are attentive and friendly. The chef seems to be talented enough to carefully design sophisticated flavors, going far beyond the average level of the neighborhood restaurants."
results.how_to_find_us: Please find us in the bar...
results.name: Let's go for Thai Food at Full Moon Thai in White Plains!

results.description:
What an excellent Meetup we had in August!  We did Woodstock proud Man!


Welcome to all our new members! Glad you all had fun.  An outstanding blend of instruments and vocals all contributed to the awesome sound of some of the best music we've played! We'll be at Classic Quiche in Teaneck again, where the seats are comfortable & the music is hot!

Come early @ 6:00 PM and have dinner! For the full menu, go to www.classicquiche.com.  Experience has shown that all goes smoothly, if only the voices and bass plug in and the rest is acoustic. Do bring mics if you have them.  By all means, if you're playing a solo or finger-picking, temporary amplification is fine! 
We are a friendly, inviting and inclusive group--so join us! 
Download our latest BCAM Songbook by clicking on MORE then FILES section of the Meetup site.

**NOTES 
The restaurant doesn't have a liquor license, so BYOB!

A $5 cover charge will be collected from musicians, 100% of which goes to the venue. 

FOR ALL OTHERS, A $10 MINIMUM FOOD/BEVERAGE CHARGE WILL APPLY**

results.description:
Stormy Weather is the best for Swing Dancing.  See you all tonight.

 The Crescent City Maulers are playing tonight. We will be there for their first gig at the newly renovated Swing 46. 


Also I moved the Meeting place to the Starbucks next to Chase bank on the intersection of Union Turnpike and Queens Blvd.

We will start meeting at 7:15 and will start walking to the E train at 7:30 sharp. Please have your Metro Card in advance.


Let me know in the comments section of this event if you plan to meet us directly at Swing 46.  It is located on Restaurant Row between 8 and 9 Avenues on 46 Street.  The address is 349 West 46th Street. 


There is a $15 entertainment fee at the door. Also please buy a drink or something like a burger to keep the establishment going.

The free dance lesson starts at 9:00 pm. I want to be settled in and available for that part.


You are welcome to stay until 1:00 am but I am planning to leave at midnight. I will take the E train back. It runs local on the way back.

I have had hikers calling me to update their RSVP status because they do not have internet availability.  Please do not call me to update your RSVP.  We need to keep the communication on this site.


Keep Hikin (and swingn')

Kevin
results.name: Saturday Swing Dance

results.description:
Hi All,
We have yet another fun place for a social/comedy night Meetup. This one is located in Berkeley Heights, NJ which is a cool and causal, comedy night cafe. They serve coffee, sandwiches, and desserts. It is also byob permissible.


Headliner:

Headliner: Mike Gaffney

NBC's Last Comic Standing, Major NYC Clubs

Mike grew up in a tough New Jersey neighborhood where he quickly learned he needed to get tough or get funny...He’s not that tough but Mike Gaffney is very funny. Mike's style of comedy is very conversational discussing day to day life not only as a single dad but as a friend, son, uncle and all around good guy. Wherever Mike performs, whether it be in a New York City comedy club or a town fundraiser, Mike wins audience's love and respect with his personal take on life and fatherhood. People all over, find Mike very relate-able and likable. His high energy and quick wit keep audiences engaged and entertained the entire time. Mike took to the stage at 32 which is a little older than most. He spent a few years grinding it out before taking a break like many comics do. In 2009, Mike decided that his love for comedy was too strong, so he hit the stage full speed ahead and hasn't slowed down. Mike works regularly at most clubs in NYC as well as comedy clubs up and down the east coast. You can also hear Mike on his weekly podcast The Disgruntle Dad.

Mike was a semi-finalist on this season’s Last Comic Standing on NBC. Executive Producer Wanda Sykes was so impressed with Mike, she used his clip to promote Last Comic Standing on Ellen NBC as well as The View on ABC.

He has appeared on The Artie Lange Show Direct TV, was on the first season of Gotham Comedy Live as well as The Best of Gotham Comedy Live AXS TV, and 30 Rock NBC. He has had rave reviews in both the Examiner and Reality Rewind.

" This guy is so good! His delivery is amazing and his jokes were excellent. He told his life and I loved hearing about it and he was spot-on!" Keenan said he loved it and it was a great set. Russell said it was a great set and he has a fresh take on raising them. Roseanne said he was getting pissed off and she was relating and she loved it. - Todd Betzold Whether he is talking about being a single father, or clean living; his show appeals to audiences of all ages.

Feature: John Clark

The Comedy Works, NYC Underground Comedy Festival, Gotham Comedy Club

John Clark left the sunshine of his native California several years ago for New York City winters and a career in Stand-Up Comedy -- and he’s never looked back!

His combination of smart, original material and a commanding stage presence have made him an audience favorite across New York City and the tri-state area.

Drawing on hilarious stories gathered from his everyday life and a cracked way of looking at the world, John will leave you laughing and asking for more!

Feature:

Ken Krantz-Gotham, Sirius XM Radio, Stress Fact

Host: Ritu Chandra, Rocco Romeo

Two item minimum, Tickets: $20 at door, or $15 online:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/comedy-madness-maras-tickets-18335550124
results.name: Mad Laughs at Mara's

results.description:
Hi!

The season is coming up fast so let's start planning how we're getting up there. Join us for the first of many Meetups connecting skiers and snowboarders with carpools to the mountains. 

If you can't make it, no worries! There's one on Oct 8th too! And plenty more to come after that....

Agenda:

It's going to be super casual but below are some things we might want to think about...

Mingle, network, drink and make plans to carpool


Intro the group

Intro ourselves

Call for drivers and riders

Discuss best practices and operations for the group

Open mic

Bring your friends!

Venue:

Flannery's is an Irish bar with a lot of standing room, dartboards, tables, booths, good music and tv's. It's a bit of a dive but a good spot. Some awesome delivery/take-out food near by too (Dirty Bird, anyone?) http://www.yelp.com/biz/flannerys-bar-new-york

Some shred for you:

2015 ski vid trailers all in one place - http://freeskier.com/stories/trailer-time-watch-2015s-best-ski-film-trailers-all-in-one-place

The Burton teaser - http://whitelines.com/videos/burton-presents-2016-teaser.html#kGIFXiCiwkEwqiuq.97

The Snowboarder movie: SFD ("Straight Fucking Down") - http://www.snowboarder.com/vimeo-on-demand/the-snowboarder-movie-sfd/#WHqiylGQLYI0EbPO.97
results.how_to_find_us: Check the dartboards in the back or text 646 598-SNOW
results.name: NJ/NY Ski and Snowboard Carpool Meetup (Manhattan)

venue.name: The Wheeltapper Pub at The Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at The Wheeltapper Pub.

At present we need women (and mainly women) aged 29 to 39 although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.

Grab friends and come along to The Wheeltapper Pub to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance. Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>). If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

regards, Daniel
results.name: email danielb1035@gmail.com

group.name: New York City Free Speeddating Group

results.description:
Dancing is a great way to meet people! This dance lesson also works as a great ice-breaker and we rotate partners to help you to get to know everyone at the Meetup. 

It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends. You'll receive a professional 1 hour Merengue & Bachata lesson.

Tickets: 

*$15 advance admission is required. Limited space available. Must Prepay here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/merbac/

*Only 20 tix at this price (goes up to $25 as events gets closer) 

Special Note - Payment for this event will include admission to our party immediately following which will feature DJs playing Bachata, Merengue, Salsa and more! 

Reminder, for this event, space is limited so an RSVP alone won't hold your spot.  You need to purchase a ticket to be confirmed. 

Multiple Meetup groups are co-organizing this event so the RSVP's shown here won't reflect total # of members attending.  We expect to have 20-30 members to attend. This is not intended to be completely gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. 

Get tickets at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/merbac/

results.description:
Join us @ Rio Bravo for the Best in Mexican Cuisine!!!

At Rio Bravo Tacos and Tequila in Larchmont, formerly The Globe, there's a build-your-own margarita menu and customizable table-side guacamole, in addition to a long menu of Mexican-American standbys like tacos, carnitas and enchiladas.

A good fit for both ladies night and family outings, Rio Bravo's menu is affordable (most entrees cost between $8 and $16) and offers a mix-and-match option so indecisive eaters can choose one item from each section and sample everything.

The space is festive and saturated with color (each wall painted is a different one), and there are Dia de los Muertos statues set in lit alcoves. The sunny street-facing dining room connects to the bar in the back, where there are 55 varieties of tequilas and fun margarita combinations (available in pitchers), like the flaming and salty Torero.

Keep an eye on the restaurant's Facebook page for happy hour and weekday specials, such as Taco Tuesday, Karaoke Thursday and Mariachi Sunday.
results.how_to_find_us: ASK FOR SEATING WITH STACY
results.name: JOIN US FOR MEXICAN FIESTA NIGHT @ A NEW VENUE "RIO BRAVO" IN LARCHMONT!!!

Looking forward to seeing you there!  Jessica
results.name: Let's get together and make music!

results.description:
Mari Black is a 'multistyle' violinist. She's of Scottish heritage and kicks butt with her fiddle. Mari is the 2015 & 2013 U.S. National Scottish Fiddle Champion, the 2014 Glenfiddich Scottish Fiddle Champion, the 2014 & 2012 Canadian Maritime Fiddle Champion, the 2011 Canadian Novelty Fiddle Champion, a 1st Prize Winner at the 2010 American Protégé International String Competition, and a 2-time laureate at the American String Teachers’ Association Alternative Styles Awards.

She's having a concert at the Puffin Cultural Forum where I work and I wanted to share the event with you because it's too good not to share. You do have to make reservations and there is a $10 per ticket price but I can make sure you guys get front seats.

Please call[masked] and let me know if you want to make reservation. Should be a great concert. Mari will be playing with guitar and whistle player from Dallas, Joseph Carmichael and bassist from Detroit, Joe Magar.
results.name: Mari Black concert at Puffin Cultural Forum

results.description:
Ed will be hosting the trivia but will save a table for the meetup group. 

-----------

DATE: Saturday, October 3rd 2015 

LOCATION: Red Oak Diner, Hazlet NJ

TIME: 8:00         

SET UP: For those of you that haven't played in the past... I'll read the questions out loud and each team will give one "team" answer, which will be written down.  I'll grade all answers and the team with the highest score at the end of the game will  be the winners.  

DINNER: There is no cost to play trivia but it's requested that everyone order something.  There is a full menu of food & drinks and YES ALCOHOL IS AVAILABLE!!!!  Each table will be responsible for it's own bill.  

GAME: 45 YEARS OF POP CULTURE TRIVIA... everything and anything that happened from the 1970's through today including TV, Sports, Music, Movies, Literature and Current Events. 

Prizes:  Each member of the winning team will get a gift card to return to The Red Oak.
results.name: Pop Culture Trivia Night at The Red Oak

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similiar groups.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 in advance only - $10 at door if available

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Social at World Bar

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC

results.description:
Looking to meet new people in a friendly and casual environment? Join us for this private multi-group social for all new and existing members.

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience!

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other.  It's fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Oct-03-2015_at_0800PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY ($10 - Price goes to $15 as event gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Oct-03-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own.

How many people attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event and we'll have 75+ members attending. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No. We'll have a wide range of ages attending. All are welcome 21+. 

What's venue like? The World Bar is an upscale lounge with lots of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

What do I wear? Neat casual.

How do I get there? Take any east side line (4,5,6) trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st St. Then short walk towards the East River.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Oct-03-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Private Member Saturday Night Social (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hoisted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups andwww.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go? We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].
