results.description:
Beyond Faith is a support group for young people under 30 who are currently, or have in the past, gone through the often difficult process of leaving Christianity. Beyond Faith is for the person who doesn't quite fit in with the pack, a person whose ideals and beliefs do not jive with their peers, family members, or loved ones. This can be a tough journey, especially for those whose family and friends are unsupportive of their doubts and lack of belief. Our group aims to create a safe space of support, community, inclusiveness, and encouragement on this journey away from Christianity and towards a reason-based worldview. For some, just the idea of entertaining serious doubts about faith can be dangerous and overwhelming, and Beyond Faith seeks to ease the process and create a warm, welcoming and optimistic environment for like-minded folks on the same path.


Beyond Faith is open to any young people who identify as atheist, agnostic, Humanist, or who are having doubts about Christianity. We are open to any and all denominations of Christianity. Beyond Faith is a safe space for women, people of color, LGBTQ people, and those who are differently-abled. Because of this, the facilitators and participants of this group will be expected to keep member identities, meeting locations, and content confidential to protect everyone involved.

In order to ensure the confidentiality and safety of our group members, please email [masked] with the following questionnaire for the location details.


New Member Questionnaire:
In an effort to ensure all members of this group are respectful and open to others, we ask that you fill out this short questionnaire so the organizers can tailor the group to its members. We have a zero-tolerance policy for evangelism at our meetings; people attending for the sake of evangelizing will be asked to leave. We do this in an effort to protect our members and ensure that our group is a safe space for all attendees.

This is NOT an application, all serious members will be invited regardless of answers to the questions below.

1. Why are you interested in Beyond Faith?

2. Can you tell us a little about yourself (including name/age/where you're from), and how your experiences have brought you the point you're at now? [You only need to share as much as you are comfortable with]

3. Do you define yourself as any/all of the following: atheist, agnostic, humanist, nontheist, or any other term?

4. Where would you consider yourself on your journey out of Christianity and into atheism/agnosticism/nontheism/etc?

 

Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. You are welcome and encouraged to bring friends and family members that you think may benefit from this group as well. We look forward to having you!

 

As there is limited space, we ask that you only attend if you are under the age of 30. If, however, you are older than 30 and are very interested in attending, or have attended our discussions in the past, please send us a private message and we may be able to work something out.
results.name: Beyond Faith: An Ex-Christian Student Support Group

results.description:
Back again . . . the group has been on hiatus for a while as I was traveling in France and Spain.  So I thought I’d start up the group again by featuring areas that I visited: Mediterranean Spain, from Catalonia down to Málaga. 

Along this stretch of coastline, the most prominent wine region is Catalonia in general, and Priorat in particular.  Priorat has become one of the most dynamic wine regions in Spain, producing some of the world’s best expressions of Garnacha, made by superstar winemakers.  But . . . we won’t be having any.  I thought it would be interesting to explore the many lesser-known regions and wine grapes of Mediterranean Spain.  If you’ve never tried a Sumoll, Bobal, or Romé wine (this last grape I’d never even heard of), here’s your chance.

The regions that will be featured, from north to south:

Empordà (Catalonia):  This region has much in common with Roussillon, just across the French border.  Strongly Mediterranean climate, steeply terraced granite and schist vineyards.  But Empordà suffered greater setbacks from the 19th-century phylloxera invasion, and even now there are terraced hillsides that have never been replanted.  However there are some ambitious new winemakers in Empordà, following the example of their nearby Roussillon counterparts.  The best reds are from old-vines Garnacha and Cariñena, but we will be trying a white, a Garnacha Blanca from 60-year-old vines.

Penedès (Catalonia):  This is the largest and, in terms of volume produced and diversity of styles, the most important wine region of Catalonia.  Two important transformations occurred in Penedès—first, in the late 19th century, phylloxera-plagued vineyards of red grapes were replaced with white varietals, from which the sparkling Cava industry was born.  Then in the 1960s, it was the first Spanish region to introduce modern winemaking methods, including stainless-steel tanks and temperature controls. Winegrowers experimented with nontraditional French varietals.  But we’ll be trying a very unusual local grape that has been saved from extinction—the little-known Sumoll. 

Costers del Segre (Catalonia):  This is Catalonia’s most inland wine region—a harsh, semi-arid region that is isolated from Mediterranean influences. Irrigation here is essential. The cooler regions produce grapes for Cava (Parellada, Macabeo, Xarel-lo), and the warmer areas are suitable for red grapes (Tempranillo, Garnacha).  And Costers del Segre was the first Catalan region to authorize the use of international varieties in DO wines, such as Cabernet and Pinot Noir.  We’ll be trying an unusual (and intense) Syrah that was fermented in an ancient manner—in stone troughs called lagars.  I tried this wine at a wine bar in Girona—maybe the best €6 glass of wine I’ve ever had.

Utiel-Requena (Valencia):  Proceeding about 250 km down the coast, the next wine region you encounter is Valencia.  Utiel-Requena, a flat, dry plateau situated 70 km inland, is Valencia’s largest subregion, long known for bulk wine production using the prolific, heat-tolerant Bobal grape.  But as is happening in many wine regions around the world, ambitious new producers are focusing on quality winemaking, elevating the reputation of a little-known region and grape.  Bobal is deeply colored and tannic, but the tannins are countered by bright acidity, making it a refreshing food wine.  The Bobals I tried in Valencia were among the most interesting wine discoveries of my trip. 

Bullas (Murcia):  Further down the coast, Bullas is another hot, dry plateau that straddles the line between Mediterranean climate and the hot summer/cold winter pattern of a continental region.  Monastrell is the signature grape here, a dark, thick-skinned variety that can have savory, smoky, meaty aromas and flavors.  The wines have traditionally been drunk young, but more ambitious producers make ageworthy examples matured in oak.  We will be trying an oak-aged Bullas Monastrell/Syrah blend made by Norrell Robertson, a Master of Wine and the escocés volante (flying Scotsman) of the wine’s name.  A 2006 vintage, this sturdy wine still retains its youth.

Málaga:  This is a heavily tourism-dependent region on the Mediterranean coast of Andalucía where the signature wines are sweet Moscatel and fortified Pedro Ximénez.  Dry table wines are produced, but it can be a challenge to find them.  This may be the only wine region I’ve ever visited where the local wines are not actively promoted.  In Málaga and Marbella, I’d inquire about local wines, and I’d almost invariably be steered toward a Rioja, Rueda, or Ribera del Duero.  But they do make some good stuff—in the town of Ronda, I had a Serrania de Ronda Cabernet Sauvignon that was almost as remarkable as the view from my lunch table.  We’ll be trying two dry wines from Málaga, a dry Muscat from famed sweet wine maker Jorge Ordoñez and an oak-aged red blend that is mostly old-vines Garnacha and includes the rare, local Romé grape.   

We’ll be meeting at Le Village in the East Village, a French bistro with an interesting, mostly vegetarian menu (although if you want pâté, coq au vin, or steak frites, you can get those too).

http://levillagenyc.com/

2009 Vinyes dels Aspres Blanc dels Aspres  (Empordà, Catalonia)  $28   

Jancis Robinson 16.5/20 – Grenache Blanc. Rich and powerful. Easy to like. White Châteauneuf. Quite alcoholic. Big and lemon cream.

2013 Jorge Ordoñez & Co Botani Moscatel Seco (Málaga)  $17 

Wine Advocate 90 – One of my favorite dry white wines in the world is Jorge Ordoñez & Co.'s 2013 Botani, a dry Muscat from an area known for making dessert wines from Moscatel de Alexandria. Vinified totally dry, it is a riveting, perfumed, flowery white exhibiting notes of melons, honeysuckle and tropical fruits in a light-bodied, zesty, naked style. There are 5,000 cases of this cuvée, which for ten years has been a reference point for what can be accomplished with this grape in terms of making dry wines versus the sweeter wines for which this area is famous.

2011 Pardas Collita Roja (Penedès, Catalonia)  $33 

Wine Advocate 93 – The 2011 Collita Roja is produced from Sumoll grapes from a single vineyard of 0.72 hectares in St. Llorenc d'Hortons on chalky soils, planted in 1949. The wine has a bright ruby color and a shiny nose of bright red fruits intermixed with strong balsamic aromas of wild herbs, intensely Mediterranean with lots of character, and a tasty, light to medium-bodied palate with piercing licorice and ripe fruit flavors that transport you to a Mediterranean forest. With time, more continental and Atlantic notes develop in the glass, which give the wine more depth and complexity. I loved it. Drink now-2020.

2011 Castell d'Encus Thalarn  (Costers del Segre, Catalonia)  $44 

Antonio Galloni 92 – (All Syrah that was fermented in stone pits and aged in 70% new French oak for 10 months.) Inky purple. Black raspberry, cherry and rooty sassafras on the pungent nose. Fleshy and expansive, offering deep cherry and dark berry flavors, a hint of olive and a suave touch of candied violet. Picks up spiciness with air and finishes on a spicy dark berry note, with very good thrust and length.

2011 Viticultores San Juan Bobal deSanjuan (Utiel-Requena, Valencia)  $13 

Wine Advocate 90 – The 2011 Bobal deSanjuan (red) was harvested from September 27, picked from organically grown vines. The nose is well defined with pressed flowers, crushed stone and a touch of balsamic. The palate is fresh and natural with good acidity, hints of mulberry and briary fruit with a very cool, Rhône-like finish that is pure and focused. This is a bright, breezy Bobal that is very well made. Drink now-2017.

2006 Escoces Volante 3000 Años (Bullas, Murcia)  $20

Wine Advocate 93 – The[masked] Años is a splendid example of old-vine Monastrell (50%) blended with 50% Syrah from the little-known D.O. of Bullas. It was aged for 12 months in 500-liter new French oak with batonnage by rotation of the barrels. Opaque purple-colored, it delivers a brooding, very Provençal nose of cedar, garrigue, violets, lavender, blueberry, and blackberry. This leads to a layered, ripe, structured, strapping wine with enough tannin to evolve for 6-8 years. The wine has more than enough fruit to provide balance and the finish is long and pure.

2012 Sedella Laderas de Sedella  (Málaga)  $18 

Wine Advocate 91 – In 2008, Lauren Rosillo planted 0.9 hectares with the same field-blend found in the original Sedella vineyard: Romé, Garnacha, Jaén (Mencía), (white) Montua and Moscatel Romano. He tried to replicate the old vineyard as much as possible on this plot located at 800 meters on a north-facing slope on slate soils. This first 2012 Laderas de Sedella also followed a very similar process, with all the grapes harvested and fermented together in stainless steel. But in this case, malolactic fermentation was carried out in a combination of oak and cement amphorae where the wine matured for 12 months without racking. The nose is a combination of flowers, Mediterranean herbs, pollen, beeswax and red berries. The palate is medium-bodied, with great acidity, very tasty, elegant and with very fine-grained tannins. Great value. 1,912 bottles produced.
results.name: Mediterranean Spain

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
“Life is about the people you meet and the things you create with them”

-- Holstee

Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change, on Monday, October 5th for Networking with Purpose - Grow Your Career & Impact Through Authentic Relationship Building (learn more about Marcos here).

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/BSCNetworkingOct5

===========================================

Are you looking for a more fulfilling job, thinking about a career change, launching a new business, or wanting to attract new business or clients? If so, one of the most critical factors to your success is building a strong and diverse network. The foundation for every job and business is engaging and building relationships with people, and networking can be the single most powerful tool you can use for accelerating your career or business, growing your impact as well as increasing happiness in your work.

In today’s rapidly-changing, hyper-competitive working world, networking is vital to creating new career and business opportunities. In fact, over 70% of jobs are found through networking and 40% of job seekers say they found their dream job though a personal connection. For entrepreneurs, a strong network is a key source for new clients, partnerships, and advice.

However, most people don’t like to “network” and often feel uncomfortable doing it. This is because the common form of networking - going to events, swapping business cards, and gathering meaningless LinkedIn connections - simply doesn't work. We need a form of networking that focuses on meaningful connections and strategic relationship building. This is what Networking with Purpose is all about.

In Networking with Purpose, Marcos Salazar will share strategies, techniques, and lessons learned in building a diverse network of thousands of professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives from every background and industry to grow Be Social Change into the largest social impact community in New York City. Marcos will show you how to build enduring, mutually beneficial relationships by providing value to others and sharing your authentic self.

**SPACE IS LIMITED**

*Doors open at 6:45 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp*

In this course, you will learn how to connect with really successful people and how to leverage your network to grow your business or advance your career 

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• How to build your networking in a purposeful, authentic, and meaningful way - while having some fun during the process!

• Develop the mindset and strategies for meeting and building authentic and mutually beneficial relationships

• How to connect with and maintain relationships with busy people

• Strategies for leveraging LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook for building your network

• Networking mistakes to avoid

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Professionals looking to create new career and business opportunities

• People seeking a new job or looking to make a career shift

• Entrepreneurs wanting to increase sales, build new partnerships, and seek advice

• Creatives and service providers (consultants, coaches, agents, and speakers) wanting to attract new clients and business opportunities

• Students or recent grads looking to build a foundation for their future career path


 INSTRUCTOR BIO

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.   


SPACE PARTNER  

The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

<a href="http://www.wework.com/"></a>

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Class: Networking With Purpose

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Divine Spirit-Part  B

Sura 15 Ayas 28–33

Behold! Your Lord said to the angels: I am about to create the human being from clay and mud molding it into shape.

When I have fashioned him and breathed My spirit into him, bow down prostrating to him.

So all the angels bowed except Iblis; he refused to be with those who prostrated.

“O Iblis,” said God, “why is it you are not with those who prostrated?”

He said, “I am not going to bow before the human being whom you made by molding clay and mud into shape.”

People are aware of their physical senses, and it is easy to recognize the body and its needs. The spirit is invisible. Becoming aware of it occurs through indirect ways. The purpose of worship is to make us aware of the spirit. For example, the word for prayer is salat which means to connect (with the spirit).

These ayas on creation  say that God has infused His spirit in mankind. That is why nothing is impossible for a human being. The spirit in us has the resourcefulness to make life into what we want. We have to switch our focus away from thinking of ourselves merely as bodies toward remembering that the divine spirit lives in each of us.

The purpose of our meeting is to discuss the nature of the spirit and how it can be harnessed to make our lives meaningful and happy.

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-Divine Spirit-Part B

 This event is a webinar.

This is a FREE event.

Registered attendees will receive the webinar log-in info via email.

This small business credit webinar is ideal for all business owners regardless of industry or years in business.  You will learn the important differences between  personal and business credit and how they are used by financial institutions, vendors and potential customers to determine your eligibility and set your terms. 

Webinar participants will find out why it's critical to separate your personal from business credit and how business credit can help you access more capital and save money.  Participants will take away proven tactics for building a stronger business credit profile. 


Our members can get a free account at Creditera to help you build your business credit.  Visit:

 http://creditera.7eer.net/c/183014/217572/2410 

About the Presenter

 Tim Graczewski is vice president of strategy and business development at Creditera.  Prior to joining the company in July 2014, Tim spent seven years at Intuit where he served as director of strategy and corporate development, head of product management for the interventional versions of QuickBooks and Payroll, and global customer care leader for QuickBooks Online.  He also held various strategic alliances and corporate development roles at Oracle Corporation.  A former naval intelligence officer in the reserves, Tim was recalled to active duty and deployed to Kandahar, Afghanistan in 2009 where he served as the lead economic development officer in NATO's Regional Command-South.  He holds a masters degree in international economics and strategic studies from Johns Hopkins University's School of Advanced International Studies and bachelor degrees in economics and political science for the University of Florida.

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:00 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6-6:45 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7-10 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

 
August 3:  Experienced Circlers Only
August 10:  Beginners at 6 and Experienced Circlers 7 pm
August 17:  Experienced Circlers Only
August 24 :  Experienced Circlers Only
August 31 : Be sure to join us for the large Community Circling Night where our community comes together for a robust night of circling with multiple facilitators and amazing group presence exercises. These nights include intro for newcomers. Register here: https://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation


3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work


- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified


(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 7 and 8: 

• Chapter 7: The Domination of the Feminine;

“Milk was destined to feed the animal’s offspring and not that man should take it with force for himself. The kid has the right to enjoy its mother’s milk and its mother’s love, but hard-hearted man, influenced by his materialistic and shallow outlook, changes and perverts these true functions. Thus the gentle kid is unable to partake of its mother’s love and rejoice in the splendor of life.” —Rabbi Abraham Kook, Chief Rabbi of Israel,

• Chapter 8: The Metaphysics of Food

“All beings tremble before violence. All fear death. All love life. See yourself in others. Then whom can you hurt? What harm can you do?” —Buddha

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world,

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.
results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 7 & 8

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1lUFJubUye7F8pqFDvKfljx08VSfgU-dR1N7NofedlTI/viewform

Just Food is an 18 year old NYC organization that empowers and supports community leaders in their efforts to increase access to locally grown food, especially in underserved New York City neighborhoods. Just Food provides training and technical assistance to community members to help them launch projects like farmers' markets and CSAs, provide education in fundamental culinary and urban agriculture skills for their neighbors, and advocate to make their corner of New York City a healthier place to live and eat.

http://www.justfood.org/about-us

results.description:
After brief report-backs on ongoing projects, we will have an open, facilitated discussion on a topic of freegan interest.  This month, we’ll be following up on our film screening and discussion urban farming as it relates to freeganism.  Bring your ideas and opinions and let’s talk!  We welcome both those with experience taking part in non-hierarchical consensus-based groups and those participating for the first time.  At 9pm, we will end our business meeting and have a brief, newcomer-friendly discussion about freeganism.  After, we will explore the area’s wasted food and other goods.  We give advice on how to salvage these goods and comment on the reasons for such waste.  The meeting is NOT open to media, but media WILL be welcome to the tour with appointment.

Meet at 7:30pm on the steps of Brooklyn Borough Hall & Plaza, Court Street & Montague, Brooklyn, NYC.  If it rains or is real cold we’ll meet in the upstairs seating area of Panera Bread, 345 Adams Street (between Willoughby St & Tech Pl), in Brooklyn Heights/Downtown Brooklyn.  Take the A, C, F or R to Jay St/Metrotech, or the 2, 3, 4 or 5 to Borough Hall.

If you arrive at an event and cannot find us, call Janet at (347)[masked] (no texts please).
results.how_to_find_us: If it rains or is real cold we’ll meet in the upstairs seating area of Panera Bread, 345 Adams Street (between Willoughby St & Tech Pl)

results.description:
Hi all! Thanks so much again to everyone who made our kick-off a success. I hope to see you all back for meetup #2.

Going forward, our meetups will be twice a month, with a similar format for each meetup:

-15 min goal setting/sharing achievements (e.g. gaining X number of new subscribers). The idea is for everyone to come as regularly as possible to keep the momentum going and to inspire others!
-30-40 min "working session" (people can just come and work on specific parts of their businesses, as well as bounce ideas off other people) or a "learning session" led by an expert in a specific area.

Next week's session is led by the amazing Sho Arora, who will talk about how to use social media to grow your business. Topics may include:

1. Choosing the best platform
2. What to post on your blog (content matters)
3. Timing- the best times to post content on different social media platforms
4. Rewarding your audience with contests and giveaways
5. Monitoring and analyzing results

Looking forward to seeing everyone!
results.name: East Village Blogger Entrepreneur Meetup #2: Leveraging Social Media

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

The beauty of a group meditation is that you can experience both self-exploration while also connecting to the energy of others.

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.
results.how_to_find_us: The Freeport Rec Center is just west of the Meadowbrook Parkway on Merrick Road
results.name: Bodhi Meditation  - Freeport Long Island (FREE**)

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

results.description:
Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer

Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

Classes start this Monday 8:00pm to 9:00pm

$20 a single class, $45 for 3 classes, $60 for 4.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON NYC

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and meditation after class.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, have the day off, or just coming from work...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play. A tennis pro will also be on-hand.


Note: it may be necessary to move people around to keep it interesting or match people with like skills.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

ATTENDANCE

Unable to attend or need to change the day? If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show.  I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.

We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.
results.name: Partners in Business: North Jersey Referrals Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
As the title says, this class is for anyone looking to wake up and start their day with vigorous, outdoor bodyweight workout. Push ups, pull ups, dips, squats, lunges, kickouts, and many more calisthenic moves will have you energized and ready for the day! Morning people COME JOIN US!

Walk ups welcome, RSVPs appreciated ;)

$20.00 per person
results.name: "Rise and Grind" Workout

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

BNI Dream Team As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, August 11th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.
results.name: GET READY TO GROW YOUR BUSINESS!

results.description:
Come once, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. It is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally. We are BNI-affilliated, and value the philosophy of "Givers Gain". We are committed to help one-another succeed. Somewhat like having a part-time sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team. If you will. "If I help you, you'll want to help me, and we'll both benefit".

RSVP now and come promote your business at an upcoming Tuesday morning meeting!

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

Tuesday Morning Match

Kent Street Pitch, Bushwick Inlet Park

7:20 Warm up / Team selection

7:30 Game

Roll out of bed and come kick a few. See you on the pitch

***Starting Tuesday October 6th there will be a $1.00 – $2.00 charge for every match. THIS FEE WILL BE COLLECTED IN CASH AT THE BEGINNING OF EVERY MATCH NOT THROUGH MEETUP. When you pay the fee you will receive a bib. We will only have enough bibs for 6 teams of 9x9. This will mean that we will have a maximum of 3 matches. After the bibs have been distributed there will be no add ons. We will work on a strictly first come first served policy. If you show up late and the bibs are gone you will not have a match. Show up early and you are good. 

***If you show up late and the bibs are gone you will not have a match. Show up early and you will have a match. 

We will never turn anyone away due to an inability to pay. If the fee is a problem talk to me. But we are hoping this will provide an incentive for people 

- Kyle, FTFC

results.description:
FREE full-day 6-track NoSQL conference covering Big Data, Mobile, Operations, Architecture and Development with Couchbase!

RSVP Now at http://www.cvent.com/d/1rq5wt/4W

Full info: http://www.couchbase.com/couchbase-live-nyc-2015/

Sample of just a few of the sessions:

• Role of NoSQL in the Big Data Ecosystem

• Introduction to Couchbase

• Couchbase Server 4.0 Overview

• Sneak Peak into N1QL and Multi-Dimensional Scaling

• Indexing and Querying with Couchbase N1QL

• Data Modeling & Developing with Couchbase

• Deploying Couchbase on Microsoft Azure

• Couchbase Mobile in Action

Highlights:

Opening Keynote: NoSQL NoLimits
Hear and see how Couchbase Server 4.0 breaks the limits of NoSQL with two major innovations: N1QL (“nickel”), the first comprehensive query language that extends SQL for JSON; and Multi-Dimensional Scaling, a new architecture that lets you isolate and independently scale Query, Index, and Data services. The result: Blazing performance, unlimited scaling, and query without compromise – plus a whole new level of developer agility. See Couchbase Server 4.0 in action.

Offline First: How GE Integrated Couchbase Mobile in Less Than 90 Days
Today’s innovative software is providing new ways for industrial companies to gain a competitive advantage. But harnessing that potential from scratch isn’t easy. You need to bring together device connectivity, data integration and management, data analytics, cloud, and mobility all in a way that works seamlessly together and intuitively for all the members of your business. That’s why GE created Predix. In the connected world, GE field engineers work in places where offline is the norm. This presentation will examine how the Predix Experience engineering team built a platform for building applications for the industrial workforce and how Couchbase Mobile complements GE’s Offline First approach. We will look at what Offline First means and how the platform’s offline capabilities were replaced with Couchbase Mobile in less than 90 days.

Agility with Data Modeling at DIRECTV Using N1QL
Today’s companies are challenged to change rapidly and while maintaining high quality standards. Managing Entity–relationship models has become a constraint to these objectives. Now, NoSQL solutions and dynamic languages are offering a simplified approach to modeling real world objects. In particular, JavaScript offers an end-to-end solution – from the user’s web browser to the JSON object stored in the database. By integrating Couchbase into the picture, the performance and flexibility offered by projects with these technologies will become the next big thing: fast paced development, agile changes, high performance, easily scalable, and feature rich. This presentation is about the benefits and challenges of an architecture based on: Node.js, Couchbase and N1QL.

Introducing N1QL: Query Without Compromise
This session introduces Couchbase’s query language for JSON, N1QL, and sets the stage for the rich selection of N1QL-related sessions at Couchbase Connect 2015. N1QL extends the querying power of SQL with the modeling flexibility of JSON. In this session, Couchbase’s Chief Architect of Query, Gerald Sangudi will give you an introduction to the N1QL language, architecture, and ecosystem. Hear the benefits of N1QL for developers and for enterprises.

The conference venue will be at Cipriani Wall Street, which stands as a triumph of Greek revival architecture, as well as a grand and luxurious venue for events. This New York landmark served as the home of the New York Merchants Exchange, the New York Stock Exchange, the United States Customs House, and the headquarters of the National City Bank. Impeccable attention to detail, the finest cuisine and classic service sets the stage for the most sought after event experiences.

Register Now for FREE at http://www.cvent.com/d/1rq5wt/4W
results.name: Couchbase Live New York Conference (Free!!!) + Free Evening Cocktail Reception

You need to bring together device connectivity, data integration and management, data analytics, cloud, and mobility all in a way that works seamlessly together and intuitively for all the members of your business. That’s why GE created Predix. In the connected world, GE field engineers work in places where offline is the norm. This presentation will examine how the Predix Experience engineering team built a platform for building applications for the industrial workforce and how Couchbase Mobile complements GE’s Offline First approach. We will look at what Offline First means and how the platform’s offline capabilities were replaced with Couchbase Mobile in less than 90 days.

Agility with Data Modeling at DIRECTV Using N1QL
Today’s companies are challenged to change rapidly and while maintaining high quality standards. Managing Entity–relationship models has become a constraint to these objectives. Now, NoSQL solutions and dynamic languages are offering a simplified approach to modeling real world objects. In particular, JavaScript offers an end-to-end solution – from the user’s web browser to the JSON object stored in the database. By integrating Couchbase into the picture, the performance and flexibility offered by projects with these technologies will become the next big thing: fast paced development, agile changes, high performance, easily scalable, and feature rich. This presentation is about the benefits and challenges of an architecture based on: Node.js, Couchbase and N1QL.

Introducing N1QL: Query Without Compromise
This session introduces Couchbase’s query language for JSON, N1QL, and sets the stage for the rich selection of N1QL-related sessions at Couchbase Connect 2015. N1QL extends the querying power of SQL with the modeling flexibility of JSON. In this session, Couchbase’s Chief Architect of Query, Gerald Sangudi will give you an introduction to the N1QL language, architecture, and ecosystem. Hear the benefits of N1QL for developers and for enterprises.

The conference venue will be at Cipriani Wall Street, which stands as a triumph of Greek revival architecture, as well as a grand and luxurious venue for events. This New York landmark served as the home of the New York Merchants Exchange, the New York Stock Exchange, the United States Customs House, and the headquarters of the National City Bank. Impeccable attention to detail, the finest cuisine and classic service sets the stage for the most sought after event experiences.

Register Now for FREE at http://www.cvent.com/d/1rq5wt/4W
results.name: Couchbase Live New York Conference (Free!!!) + Free Evening Cocktail Reception

RSVP Now at http://www.cvent.com/d/1rq5wt/4W


Full info: http://www.couchbase.com/couchbase-live-nyc-2015/

Sample of just a few of the sessions:


• Role of NoSQL in the Big Data Ecosystem

• Introduction to Couchbase

• Couchbase Server 4.0 Overview


• Sneak Peak into N1QL and Multi-Dimensional Scaling

• Indexing and Querying with Couchbase N1QL

• Data Modeling & Developing with Couchbase

• Deploying Couchbase on Microsoft Azure

• Couchbase Mobile in Action


Highlights:

Opening Keynote: NoSQL NoLimits
Hear and see how Couchbase Server 4.0 breaks the limits of NoSQL with two major innovations: N1QL (“nickel”), the first comprehensive query language that extends SQL for JSON; and Multi-Dimensional Scaling, a new architecture that lets you isolate and independently scale Query, Index, and Data services. The result: Blazing performance, unlimited scaling, and query without compromise – plus a whole new level of developer agility. See Couchbase Server 4.0 in action.

results.description:
Join VetsinTech in NYC for a very special event hosted by the Workday Foundation!! Workday is currently listed by Fortune Magazine as one THE top tech companies to work for.
Workday and their employees will be supporting our veterans looking to get into tech careers - with a special presentation by LinkedIn, VIP speakers, employees help with resumes, elevator pitches and mentorships!!
This event is exclusively for military veterans and all veterans must register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/vetsintech-nyc-employment-event-hosted-by-workday-foundation-tickets-18282861531

The Workday Foundation, Vets in Tech, LinkedIn and Opus Financial Services are proud to partner in support of our veterans with this special event.

Workday employees will provide advisement in creating new resumes, personal positioning & interview coaching, on-site LinkedIn profile development and mentorship.

 Customized training for veterans will be provided by LinkedIn, as well as a VIP keynote from Fred Davis, former Naval Officer and CEO of Opus Financial Services.

Agenda 

9:00-9:30 - Arrival and registration 

9:30-10:00 - Breakfast Meet and Greet   

10:00-10:15 – Workday Foundation Overview 

   Diana Fisher – Director Workday Foundation

    Noa Eisenberg and Judith Carlson - Giving and Doing Local Leader

10:15-10:30 - Vets in Tech Overview & Workday Partnership 

Dave Gowel - RockTech, CEO and Board Advisor, Wounded Warrior Project and VetsinTech and Mike Brunnick - Senior Advisor VetsinTech

10:30 - 11:00 - Keynote Speaker

       Fred Davis - CEO Opus Financial Services 

 Prior to his Wall Street success, Fred spent four years as a Radioman on-board the USS Monterey. He was responsible for maintaining onboard systems as well as communicating classified messages through Satellite High Command (SATHICOM), relaying information between the Pentagon, Command Station and on-board Navy Seals.Fred is regarded highly as an expert in his field of Risk Management and International Talent Recruiting.  As Partner and CEO of Opus FS Fred combines his military and international business experience to ensure strategic and innovative growth for Opus FS Front Office Research and Recruitment. 

 11:00 – 11:15 – Break 

11:15 - 11:45 - “LinkedIn for Veterans: How to build your LinkedIn profile” 

Rebecca Ross – LinkedIn Product Consultant 

 11:45 – 12:30 - Mentor Session One 

Resume Review/Advisement– 20 Minutes

Interview Coaching and Personal Positioning– 25 Minutes

12:30 – 1:15 – Lunch & Panel Discussion with Workday Veterans

1:15 – 1:45 - Mentor Session Two

 LinkedIn Profile development with Workday Mentor

1:45 - 2:00 - Ongoing Mentor Alignment and Wrap up

Every Tuesday the CHA will meet at 12pm at the NY Hilton hotel. The Cannabis and Hemp Association can only accept CHA Affiliates who RSVP to the event. If you wish to attend a Meetup and bring a friend, they must become a CHA Affiliate. Your friend's or collegues may become an affiliate by joining the group www.meetup.com/cannabisandhemp . Here the CHA will discuss membership benefits, offer free consultations to anyone interested in the cannabis industry, and have an open forum to discuss future Meetups and CHA monthly events.

At the Meetup, the CHA often provides written materials for the lecture. Only those who RSVP will receive a copy of the meeting notes. Our materials are distributed based on those who have RSVP'd only.

Cannabis and Hemp TV is an online video blog where specific topics in  the cannabis industry are discussed, analyzed, and broken down amongst a panel.  All observers are welcome. Please RSVP and unRSVP if you cannot attend.

The NY Hilton is free to all members of the group and members are encouraged to bring friends, business ideas, business cards, and anything they would like to discuss about all things cannabis.

results.description:
The Importance of the Mystical Experience in Jungian thought: An Introduction

Speaker: Leslie Stein, LLM.

A sense of wonder, of awe, of unity, a vision, a powerful dream, a feeling of divine presence can never be explained rationally.   Do they have any role is our process of psychic growth or are they merely random occurrences that can be safely forgotten and ignored?  Jung describes these experiences as the "real therapy."  Some have criticized this idea, saying that they are no substitute for the hard journey of self-examination.  This lecture introduces Jung's ideas as to the place of these mystical experiences in analytical psychology.

Leslie Stein, LLM, is a Senior Fellow at Pace University and in Training at the C.G. Jung Institute of New York. He is the author of Becoming Whole: Jung's Equation for Realizing God (Helios, 2012), the Jungian allegory: The Journey of Adam Kadmon: A Novel (Arcade, 2001/2012), "Jung and Tantra," 80 Spring Journal, and "Jung and Divine Self Reflection," 90 Jung Journal.
results.how_to_find_us: Arrive early for seating. Feel free to bring your lunch.
results.name: Free Tuesday Lunch Talk @ The Jung Center

RSVP here : 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/webinar-how-to-transition-to-product-management-tickets-17840689984 

If you live in New York City and would like to get a job as a Product Manager, this is the webinar for you!

Making a career switch can be a thrilling and daunting task for many. Whether you are just beginning to think about taking the leap or you're in the middle of the process, it is easy to get overwhelmed. How do you know when to leave your current role and how do you best position yourself for your next?

This is a free ONLINE event at the location of your choice on your device! It does not require anything more than one click here to watch and find out if the Product Management course is the right fit for you. Get your ticket and we will send you the URL of the webinar.

What you will learn:

• Get an overview of the curriculum and course objectives

• Meet the instructor and hear about his professional experience

• Discuss Frequently Asked Questions • Have the opportunity to ask any & all additional questions

Who is this workshop for: 

• Software engineers who want to transition to Product Management 

• MBAs with a finance/consulting background who want to work in high-tech companies as a Product Manager

• Project Managers, Marketers, Designers who are seeking for new opportunities in Product Management 

Timeline:

11:30 - 11:50pm : Presentation and Q&A

Meet the speaker: Carlos González de Villaumbrosia


Carlos is CEO at Product School. He has seven years of experience building teams and digital products on 3 Continents. He is a three times company Co-founder. Before Product School, he was the Lead Instructor of Product Management at General Assembly and Co-founder and CEO of Floqq (invested by 500Startups), the biggest marketplace for online video courses in Latin America.

Join the webinar and get to know more about Product School and its Product Management courses.

results.description:
Important Note for Office Hours regulars: Due to a conflict in my schedule, office hours will only start at 3:30PM on October 6th.

Microsoft Office Hours are a block of time set aside to allow Windows 10, mobile, cloud & IoT developers to work on their apps/games and get some help and guidance from on-site Microsoft Technical Evangelists. This is also a great opportunity to work on your own projects alongside like-minded developers, away from distractions and work interruptions.

Typical guidance offered during office hours includes:

 • Pre-vetting of your startup or indie activities for the Microsoft BizSpark program.

 • Technical guidance for mobile developers on Windows 10 & Windows Mobile, or using Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android, Cordova/PhoneGap. This is a great opportunity to get help as you build new Universal apps now that Windows 10 is here.

 • Technical guidance for cross-platform developers on Windows, iOS or Android looking to leverage Microsoft Azure within their app or games. IoT makers are also welcome for guidance on Azure connectivity.

 • Promotional guidance for mobile developers looking to drive more downloads, market and monetize their app or game.

 • User testing of your latest app or game with Microsoft and other attendees.

 • On-Site device testing of your latest app or game on various Windows devices, such as Lumia phones or Surface tablets. Make sure to post a comment specifying which devices(s) you'd like to test on. Not all devices will be available every time.

 • Get functional feedback on how to improve the overall functionality of your app or game.

 • Get user experience (UX) and usability feedback on how to improve the overall aesthetics and workflow of your app or game.

Microsoft Office Hours are open to everyone looking for some time and help to finish their project before publishing, or work on driving more downloads for their apps and games. Formal presentations are not held during office hours and these events will remain unstructured. Office hours open at 2:00PM but feel free to arrive when you want. If you have any questions about Studio Time, feel free to ask below. We also recommend that you stick around for the monthly evening presentation.

Note to Makers: If you plan on working on IoT gadgets, just remember that this is a corporate office, not a maker space. Soldering and power tools are not allowed,

Your name must be added to the building security list so please RSVP and do not show-up unannounced. Since there is a limited number of seats, please keep your RSVP up-to-date. If you RSVP'd and cannot make it, change your RSVP to "no".

FINAL NOTE: Microsoft Office Hours are about guidance, learning, sharing & testing. This is not a premier-level technical support service. If you have some esoteric bug or technical issue for which you cannot find any help online, don't expect miracles during office hours. This is why StackOverflow exists :)
results.how_to_find_us: Please keep your RSVP up-to-date since seats are limited. If you RSVP and later realize you cannot make it, please cancel your spot as a courtesy to the event host and other attendees. Click here for a map and directions: http://binged.it/1gmMluQ.

results.description:
For more info on this hiring event, and to officially RSVP please visit this sign-up page 


Please note that this is a hiring event for junior UX designers. 

Please only register for this ticket type if you are attending on behalf of a company that is looking to hire junior UX designers - please do not register if you are a recruiter or looking to hire senior/executive level talent.


About This Event


Looking for new teammates to help you analyze problems and create effective designs that better engage customers? Come meet the stellar graduates of GA's User Experience Design Immersive course on Tuesday, October 6th from 5:00pm-7:00pm at General Assembly.

You'll meet graduates who, having mastered their program, can:

Research and evaluate experiences to create information architectures, personas, and user journeys

Apply best practices while analyzing problems and creating usable designs

Visualize user experiences through content audits, user flows, wireframes, and prototypes

Create and communicate user experiences to stakeholders that adhere to business and technology constraints

Come check out their portfolios of design work and talk to them about full-time, contract and apprenticeship opportunities.

General Assembly does not collect a commission for hiring our graduates and never will. Food and refreshments will be provided!

Questions? Please email [masked]

Refund Policy

Plans change. We get it. But if you can't make it to a class/workshop, please email us at least 7 days before the scheduled event date. No refunds will be given after this timeframe.
results.name: UX DESIGNER MEET & HIRE

results.description:
The time has come to WRITE!

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. If you have been looking for a time and space to get busy adding words to a current project, then this meetup is for you. I will bring along my bag full of prompts if anyone wants to peruse them to get started, but, for all intents and purposes, this meetup is an opportunity to support you in whatever you need to be working on now.

We will be meeting in the events room at the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library on Victory Blvd close to CSI. They are tables and chairs for us, so bring your notebooks, journals or laptops with you to get your work done. There are outlets in the room and the library offers free wi-fi. We are permitted to have food and beverages, but they must remain in the room (they can't be brought out to the library itself). There is also a parking lot and bus stop right outside the building for your convenience!
