results.description:
OVERVIEW

Join us for another cool maker talk as we dive deeper into a specific hardware board: the very popular Particle Photon. This is one of the easiest boards you can use to build connected gadgets and I'll show you how to get started and integrate your gadgets with Azure cloud connectivity. This is an awesome session for beginner or veteran makers alike. If you're already an expert with the Particle boards, come join the talk, bring your gadgets and share your knowledge!

See the full session abstract below.

EVENING DETAILS

6:00PM - Doors open. Food will be served, courtesy of Microsoft. Please keep your RSVP up to date so we can properly assess how many developers to feed.

6:30PM - Introduction, housekeeping + Show & Tell. 3 developers get to talk about recent apps they published (5 minutes each, contact Nick Landry if you want to present).

6:45PM - Main presentation (see abstract below).

After the Presentation - Prize raffle courtesy of Microsoft, DVLUP and other sponsors.

Your RSVP is required to add your name to the building security guest list.

MAIN PRESENTATION

Building Connected IoT Gadgets with Particle.io & Azure

The Internet of Things (IoT) extends your reach as a software developer into the world of diverse hardware devices controlled by your code, and powered by the cloud. Connectivity is a key component in IoT. Without it, all you have is a normal “thing” that is always offline. Connecting devices isn’t always easy however, requiring custom chips, boards or shields and their associated drivers & libraries. A new generation of maker boards is now emerging – many thanks to successful crowdfunding campaigns – featuring built-in wireless hardware and everything you need to easily connect to the cloud. One of the most popular of such boards is the Particle Photon (formerly known as Spark, see https://www.particle.io) which features a built-in Wi-Fi in a small & affordable package. The Photon is a $19 development kit for creating Wi-Fi connected products, and the spiritual sequel of the Spark Core. Particle uses Wiring, the same code framework as Arduino.

This session is your introduction to building connected IoT gadgets with Particle hardware. We’ll explore the hardware & shield options, and the software platform used to program it, including both the Web and desktop IDEs. We’ll cover device setup, the command-line interface, and debugging tools. Next we’ll look at common maker scenarios and we’ll connect our gadgets to Azure – including Event Hubs and Mobile App Services – and integrate our cloud solutions with Particle’s REST API. Beginner and veteran makers are welcome to join.

ABOUT THE PRESENTER

Nick Landry – Senior Technical Evangelist, Microsoft

Nick Landry (@ActiveNick) is a mobility pioneer and former entrepreneur specializing in cross-platform mobile app development for Windows, iOS and Android devices. Nick works at Microsoft as a Senior Technical Evangelist in the New York Metro area. He spent most his career in IT consulting, software and services companies across various technical and business roles, designing, building, managing and selling innovative software products and solutions for the world’s top brands and Fortune 500 companies.

Known for his dynamic and engaging style, he is a frequent speaker at major software development conferences worldwide, was a 10-year Microsoft MVP awarded on Windows Phone Development, and a Nokia Developer Ambassador & Champion. With over 23 years of professional experience, Nick is a certified developer and software architect by trade and specializes in Cross-Platform Mobility, GIS, Cloud, IoT and Mobile Game Development. He is an active blogger, occasional author, avid gamer, loving husband and proud father.

Blog: www.AgeofMobility.com

GitHub: https://github.com/activenick

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/activenick

results.description:
Hi all.  Here is the agenda for the evening tomorrow:

• 6-6.20 PM : Introduction to Streams and new directions

• 6.20 - 6.40 PM : Streaming Geospatial Analytics, from detecting piracy to solving crimes to finding asteroids

• 6.40 - 7.00 PM :  Developing on Streams and use-cases in Manufacturing 

• 7.00 - 8.00 PM : Networking over food & drinks 


Join us on Tuesday, October 6th, to learn more about real-time streaming data and analytics. We shall introduce the IBM stream processing platform, IBM InfoSphere Streams, and talk about a few different use-cases in healthcare, finance, social media and sports.


IBM InfoSphere® Streams is an advanced computing platform that allows user-developed applications to quickly ingest, analyze, and correlate information as it arrives from thousands of real-time sources. The solution can handle very high data throughput rates, up to millions of events or messages per second. 

A component of the IBM big data platform, InfoSphere Streams processes huge volumes and varieties of data from diverse sources while achieving extremely low latency, enabling decision makers to extract relevant information for timely analysis. InfoSphere Streams radically extends the state of the art in information processing by helping organizations:

• Respond in real time to events and changing requirements

• Analyze data continuously at rates that are orders of magnitude greater than existing systems

• Adapt rapidly to changing data forms and types

• Deliver real-time cognitive computing functions to learn patterns and predict outcomes

• Manage high availability, heterogeneity and distribution for the streaming data paradigm 

Agenda : To be posted soon.
results.how_to_find_us: Room 1219
results.name: Continuous Streaming Analytics

results.description:
Are you ready to manage the Millennial?  Learn the Science & Hacks to succeeding in the 21st Century. Millennials are the largest group entering the workforce and managers need to know how to hire, communicate, train, motivate and retain them for years to come. Whether you're a Boomer manager with a Millennial team, or a Millennial managing GenX & Boomers, we're your trusted source of Learning & Development. We open the kimono and show secrets to success.

With our marketing and management course we call #SucceedFast and #PopUpSelling, we delve deep into the issues concerning today's companies; What do I need to know when hiring Millennial teams? If I'm a Millennial entrepreneur, how do I get my startup off the ground and on the fast track to success? If I've recently been put in charge of an employee with more experience than me, how to I communicate and manage them effectively?

Many companies have not mastered the art of retention with the younger generation and Millennials leave after a few years to pursue other avenues of success. With #SucceedFast and #PopUpSelling programs, we will teach you the basis of inter-generational management including how to communicate effectively in order to grow and prosper as a company, a team and an individual.

Our event will be free and we encourage you to bring a friend because the more the merrier!

Jonathan and Harrison will be your hosts and will be giving a short presentation on Management and the Millennial to show just what you need to know in order to direct your incoming employees to success! We'll have networking afterwards, drinks and hanging out. Feel free to bring cards and leave them around the venue, trade them with each other, or just come and have a drink and a snack.

Check out our websites for more information on our services and learn how to manage & sell like a pro!

http://popupselling.com/

http://succeedfast.co/

results.description:
Summer is now officially over and next month we have a great speaker line up with a mobility themed evening in October.

Sanjay Patel - Principal Consultant at Neudesic

Building Hybrid Mobile Apps using SharePoint API : What is Hybrid Mobile App and how it is different from Native mobile apps? Available Development platforms to create hybrid mobile apps and How you can create Hybrid mobile apps for SharePoint.

Sanjay Patel, is a Principal Consultant working for Neudesic, LLC who has over 12 years of experience architecting and developing Enterprise client-server web applications, mobile applications using SharePoint, .Net and latest java script frameworks. He is a SME in designing SharePoint solutions. These days he is exploring Big data and Machine learning.

Enterprise Mobility Phil Dinsmore  and Richard Conte from Infragistics

Accessing your SharePoint assets while you are mobile is essential for staying productive. So is having the power to edit, and share files, lists, images, and documents in a secure mobile environment . However, there isn't a Microsoft solution to allow your enterprise users to securely accomplish native mobile SharePoint deployment. This is where SharePlus, by Infragistics, can serve your business. In this presentation,  the Infragistics Enterprise Mobility team will answer your questions regarding how to mobilize your workforce as well as demonstrate SharePlus and what it can do for you. 

Tuesday 6th October @
results.name: Oct Meetup : Mobile night- Part 1: SharePoint Mobile Development Frameworks

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!

***

***

***Please have a government issued form of ID with you. ***

***We will be meeting at a new location, the North Academic Center of CCNY***

This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.


This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone posses a question, so bring questions!


Some topics of discussion are:
-Install/configuration assistance/ (possibly a "getting started" guide)
-Documentation/Standards/"Best Practices"
-Current events/Conventions
-Release testing/bug reporting
-Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)


You may also find someone willing to debate VI vs Emacs (however don't expect a conclusion to it ! )


A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

(If you are working a problem , some log/debugging information will be required)


Bring a project, topic or questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects.
(Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves )

The coordinators can also provide pointers based on their experience on how to get up and running as well as documentation and other resources for new users.
results.name: NYLUG Open hacker hours

results.description:
Fireside Chat Mary Chaney, Director of the Security Operations Center for Johnson & Johnson.

Mary Chaney is the Director of the Security Operations Center for Johnson & Johnson. Prior to joining J&J, Mary was the Director of Incident and Data Management for GE Capital. Mary is a former Special Agent for the FBI where she investigated Cybercrime and also acted as the Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) for the Los Angles Field Division. She also held an adjunct professor role at the University of Cincinnati where she assisted with the establishment of there Cybersecurity Certificate program. She holds her CISSP certification, is a graduate of Xavier University in Cincinnati, Ohio with a B.S.B.A in Information Systems and is a licensed attorney in the State of Texas. 

Exabeam, Greg Parda Regional Director

Applying Data Science to Monitor User Behavior in Financial Services

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Exabeam has been deploying UBA at financial services firms, including payroll processors, national, and international banks for the past two years. In the process, we have learned quite a bit about how data science can be used to enhance security within FinSvc. This presentation will discuss case studies of UBA at various firms, lessons learned, and an open discussion of how to apply UBA.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Irving Nam, Director, Technical Account Managemet

Topic: “ASK – KNOW – ACT: 15 second Visibility and Control of the Endpoint.”

Tanium was founded to deliver a new and innovative approach to endpoint management and security that delivers instant visibility and responsiveness that does not slow down as the enterprise environment scales. Tanium is empowering the largest enterprises in the world to gather critical information globally from every endpoint and drive remediating action in seconds, including the distribution of patches, applications, and tools - all from a single server.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Work in Singapore: Information Security”

Kelly Tan, Area Director, North America Contact Singapore

Based in San Francisco Bay Area, Kelly manages the North America (West Coast) operations of Contact Singapore to attract professionals to work in key growth and emerging sectors in Singapore with a focus on research, ICT and biomedical sectors.

Prior to joining Contact Singapore, Kelly spent several years in both private and non-profit sectors specialising in regulatory and governance, business development and relationship management.

Kelly graduated from the National University of Singapore with a Bachelor of Social Sciences (Hons) and received a dual Master in Public Policy and Public Affairs from Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy, NUS, and Institut d'études Politiques de Paris (Sci Po), Paris, respectively.

results.description:
Join AWC-NNJ as we co-host a combined Recruiter Night Out dinner meeting with MIS Network Associates (MNA) at the Holiday Inn in Totowa, NJ. The Recruiter Night Out will include a dialogue with a panel of four recruiters from the venues listed below responding to pre-published questions and ad hoc inquiries from the dinner meeting attendees:

•Consulting: Vinay Singh - Cogent Infotech 
•Corporate: John McKinley - Marotta Controls
•Corporate: Gregg Russo - Chugai Pharmaceutical
•Contingency: Sue McLean - Connors Group

The panel will be moderated by Janelle Razzino, President of Razzino Associates Inc., a boutique firm specializing in C-level, executive-level and mid-level placements for The Fortune Global 2000 marketplace.  There will also be a raffle donated by Razzino Associates at the end of the evening.

An entrepreneur, who speaks, teaches and consults on the growing role of emerging technology in recruitment strategies, placement, executive search, and career planning, Ms. Razzino is a subject matter expert on motivational techniques that can make a difference between success and missed opportunities.  Other key topics presented have been powerful messages on resiliency, innovative thinking, polishing your people skills, problem solving and managing multiple priorities. As a premier search organization that brings 28 years of experience in Corporate recruiting and management experience specializing in the Accounting, Finance and Information Technology disciplines across many different industries in the tri-state area, Razzino Associates, Inc. partners with its clients to understand the client’s needs and vision in this dynamic and brisk time of hiring.  Razzino Associates, Inc. dedication is and has always been to provide premier candidates to those organizations that “Demand the Best” in executive search. The company’s geographic concentration is the New York, New Jersey, CT and PA areas. She also recruits for companies in California, Florida, and the UK.

There will be Speed Networking with current members, alumni, and guests from several  other Networking groups in addition to AWC and MNA: IT-Networking, the ETP  Network, TENG, The Breakfast Club of NJ, Monmouth Networking, and Careers In  Transition (CIT).

There  will be an opportunity to circulate at least 50 copies of your resume, personal  bio, leads, or other appropriate material in a handout for each participant from the dinner. 

When: Tuesday, October 6, 2015  
6:00pm - Registration, Speed Networking, and cash bar 
6:45pm - 7:15pm - Individual Introductions 
7:15pm - Dinner 
8:00pm - Recruiter Panel discussion moderated by Janelle Razzino 
9:30pm - Raffle Donated by Razzino Associates – You Must Be There To Win


The fee for the dinner and presentation is $30 for both AWC-NNJ chapter members and guests if you RSVP by Friday, September 25.  The fee will be $45 for those who RSVP afterwards, and a limited number of seats will be available for $60 at the door. Please let us know when you RSVP if you prefer a vegetarian dinner.   An initial list of panel questions and attendees will be mailed to all RSVPs the weekend of October 4th for review and correction, with a final numbered RSVP list available at the registration desk the night of the meeting.

Note:
You may make your payment when you arrive at the meeting, but
please be aware that MNA and AWC-NNJ assumes that when you make a reservation, you are responsible for the cost whether or not you attend.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
